byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and ASHLEY PARKER

abstract: Republican presidential hopefuls give varying responses to allegations that Hillary Rodham Clinton may have used personal email account for classified government communications; some are immediately and stridently critical while others withhold comment, waiting to see how situation evolves.
lead_paragraph: The story of Mrs. Clinton’s State Department emails has given Republican candidates an opportunity to attack, and while some of them lost no time doing it, others were more restrained.

headline.main: While Some Republicans Seize Chance to Attack Hillary Clinton, Others Refrain
headline.print_headline: Focus on Clinton’s Emails Forces Republicans to Weigh Risks of Criticism

snippet: The story of Mrs. Clinton’s State Department emails has given Republican candidates an opportunity to attack, and while some of them lost no time doing it, others were more restrained.
